cot_content: We have base-16 number 66666 (i.e., hex digits). That's a number in base 16. Value = 6*16^4 + 6*16^3 + 6*16^2 + 6*16 + 6. Compute approximate. 16^1=16, 16^2=256, 16^3=4096, 16^4=65536. Sum: 6*(65536+4096+256+16+1)=6*(700+? wait compute sum: 65536+4096=69632, +256=69888, +16=69904, +1=69905. times 6 = 419430. Wait 69905*6 = 419430. So value = 419430. Now need binary digits count: find highest power of 2 <= value. 2^19 = 524,288. 2^18=262,144. 419,430 between 262k and 524k so 18 bits needed? Actually need floor(log2(419430))+1. log2(419430) ≈? 2^18=262,144, 2^19=524,288. So requires 19 bits? Wait if number is 419430, binary representation will have highest set bit at position 18 (0-indexed). So bit length = 19. Let's check: 419430 in binary? 419430 = 0b11001101111111110? Let's just compute: 419,430 decimal. 2^18=262,144. Subtract gives remaining 157,286. 2^17=131,072. remainder 26,214. 2^14=16384 remainder 9,330. 2^13=8192 remainder 1,138. 2^10=1024 remainder 114. 2^6=64 remainder 50. 2^5=32 remainder18. 2^4=16 remainder2. 2^1=2 remainder0. So bits: positions 18,17,14,13,10,6,5,4,1 set. Count 9 bits set. But length is 19 bits. So answer: 19.
sentences: We have base-16 number 66666 (i.e., hex digits).
Now need binary digits count: find highest power of 2 <= value. 2^19 = 524,288. 2^18=262,144.
419,430 between 262k and 524k so 18 bits needed? Actually need floor(log2(419430))+1. log2(419430) ≈? 2^18=262,144, 2^19=524,288.
Wait if number is 419430, binary representation will have highest set bit at position 18 (0-indexed).

Subtract gives remaining 157,286. 2^17=131,072. remainder 26,214. 2^14=16384 remainder 9,330. 2^13=8192 remainder 1,138. 2^10=1024 remainder 114. 2^6=64 remainder 50. 2^5=32 remainder18. 2^4=16 remainder2. 2^1=2 remainder0.
But length is 19 bits. So answer: 19.
